Summary: (previously named CamBuck) When Buck finds himself low on fund after the lawsuit, his brilliant Idea to get more money is to open an onlyfans, keeping his identity a secret. Thus start Eddie Diaz quest to try and control himself around Buck, while the rest of the 118 is dragged along for the ride.

entry.title: The Sunlight Of My Life
entry.summary:
Author: Pnk_strawberry1

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,919Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 5

Summary: When Eddie left for Texas, Buck told himself he‚Äôd be fine. He had the house, the memories, and the silence ‚Äî too much of it. Then a stranger shows up at his door with news that knocks the air out of him: he‚Äôs the father of an eight-year-old girl named Alina Marie Monroe.Oh ‚Äî and her mother‚Äôs dead. When Eddie finally comes home, the two of them fall into a rhythm that feels almost like a family. Almost. But love gets complicated when it‚Äôs the one thing neither of them has ever had the courage to name. Between bedtime stories, quiet mornings, and the ghosts of what-ifs, Buck and Eddie begin to realize that sometimes family isn‚Äôt something you find ‚Äî it‚Äôs something you build, one heartbeat at a time. Or:Buck becomes a dad. Eddie comes home. And somewhere between friendship and forever, they find the sunlight again. ‚òÄÔ∏è Ft A short Christopher & Alina Side Story!

entry.title: The Family We Chose
entry.summary:
Author: Pnk_strawberry1

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,170Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 66

Summary: Evan Buckley was truly fucked. One week after leaving the only home he‚Äôd ever known‚Äîhis parents‚Äô house‚ÄîGround Zero hit, and the world went to hell. Eight months later, he‚Äôs still searching for his sister Maddie in Los Angeles, armed only with a tear-stained note: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm leaving Doug. I‚Äôm going to Los Angeles.‚ÄùWhen Buck finally tracks her to Safe Zone 118, he realizes that maybe having a family‚Äîand surviving alongside people who actually care‚Äîisn‚Äôt so bad.At 118, firefighter Eddie Diaz, a single dad, turned his fire station into a refuge with his team when Ground Zero struck. Just trying to keep his kids safe, he‚Äôs thrown for a loop when a stranger shows up claiming to be Maddie‚Äôs brother. Buck is skilled, prepared, and oddly magnetic‚Äîforcing Eddie to question everything he thought he knew about survival, trust, and maybe even‚Ä¶ something more.

entry.title: Dearly Departed
entry.summary:
Author: PhenomenalWoman

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,023Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 155

Summary: On his first day, Eddie sees the ghost before he meets him. There is a boy, younger than Christopher but not by much, who runs around the station like it‚Äôs a playground. For a second, while Eddie is pulling a shirt over his head, he thinks the boy is real and someone ought to be watching out for him because a fire station is no place for a kid that young to play unsupervised. And then the boy, pale, skinny and too frail for his age, passes through an exiting member of C shift like wind through a plastic bag. A ghost. ‚ÄúWho the hell is that?‚Äù Eddie watches as the ghost ‚Äì just a fucking kid, really ‚Äì whips his head around to the voice. His face lights up and Eddie‚Äôs heart sinks because how cruel can this world be? He turns around and Eddie is struck. The man is strong and broad, all blue eyes and defined features. If it weren‚Äôt for the splotch of color above his eyebrow, Eddie would think that the man and the little boy standing at his side were genetic matches. OR Eddie Diaz can see ghosts ‚Äî that‚Äôs nothing new. The little boy following around his new coworker is a different story.

entry.title: The Beauty of a Secret (you know you're supposed to keep it)

entry.title: homesick (but I'd leave it behind to be with you night after night)
entry.summary:
Author: titaniclikeship003

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,863Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 33

Summary: Approximately 70% of people worldwide report having a "love-filled day" on a typical day. Around 1 in 50 people find their partner on a plane. 55% of Americans have met their soulmate, and yet somehow, someway, Eddie Diaz and Evan Buckley defied all of these odds and found each other during a six hour delay. Stuck in an airport with nothing else to do but fall in love.
